snippet.textDisplay: If there are viruses there are variants, as most viruses (and all living cells) mutate. A country where a variant was first detected  may or may not be the country where it originated. Hence naming a variant by a name of the country where it was first detected not only adds stigma, it could also be scientifically inaccurate. Thanks for the excellent science in 5!!!
